pr_title: feat(gateway): Add a health info in the gateway's API.

timeline.message: feat(gateway): Add a health info in the gateway's API.

chore(gateway): add gateway tests

I've add some test to verify a partition health changing with a gateway's API.

timeline.bodyText: I think this test is not necessary. You've changed a property of the topology and then again get the same object and alter it again. Just once is fine. Or am I missing something?
timeline.author: korthout

replies.bodyText: There I'm thinking to test simultaneously changing the health of two partitions. All can work fine if the broker changes the health of one partition but not for many :) I'm don't sure that this needs to be tested but anyway, what do you think? :)
replies.author: aivinog1

replies.bodyText: That makes sense, but you can do that in one go. No need for the additional setup. (I understand marking 1 partition first as healthy may matter for your implementation, but that should not be part of the test IMO)
replies.author: korthout

replies.bodyText: Also make sure to change the name of the test method accordingly. Something like: shouldUpdateMultiplePartitionHealths
replies.author: korthout

timeline.bodyText: Please add an additional test case where you explicitly make this value unhealthy. Or change both in the same case and change the test case name to something like shouldRespondWithUpdatedPartitionHealth
timeline.author: korthout

timeline.bodyText: nitpick: I suggest you change the name of the variable to response (its clear where it comes from) and change the type definition to var because it can easily be inferred.
timeline.author: korthout

replies.bodyText: nitpick: There's some other places where you reduce the variable name length and where you can apply var instead of an explicit type.
replies.author: korthout

timeline.author: korthout

timeline.bodyText: You don't need this line in this test. I understand that it may seem so due to your implementation, but I'd rather test behaviour. So just setting 1 partition to unhealthy should be enough for this test.
